instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message:
got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green light and orange when bat is connected.  no fan and no power.  checked the fuse, checked the one wire circuit seemed like everything was good.  Were should i test?
Thanks Again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message:
What voltage is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
What voltage is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?
What voltage is <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>?
What voltage is <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>?
Why is this dead? Drop, spill, or none of the above?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  -- 12.56v
 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>  --   3.32v
 <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>  --    5.1v
 <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>  --   0v  my issue is  apparently on  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> circuit 

Def. water damaged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: Voltages on <CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR>/03? Where was the liquid. clock chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: liquid was about 2-3 Inch in size or more around the lvds.  i did ultra sonic it prior.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: I asked more.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message:
oh shit!!! sorry i took the measurement but for got to post them!

<CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR> @3.3v
03 @ 3.3v

Also were is the clock chip? / part number?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>. How is <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/03 looking?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message:
hmm. i guess this board was not ultra sonic cleaned yet.  it has soda pop on it pretty bad wrote down the primary affected areas for reference.  replaced some parts on the g3h, pp3v3 and ppbus, along with a few other parts.  there is way to much soda on/ under chips to expect it to power on at this point so when its done with its bath i will update.  sorry i didnt realize this before.  

The <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> did not look affected but in the same area i found some nasty looking stuff.  (which led me to my realization here)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: okay so now its powering on and working, the only thing is that its charging the computer but it wont run off of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: Battery recognized in OSX with cycles and charge capacity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: Yes.  It give me the cycles, charge capacity,  how much it has to go etc.  and it says its charging. and i was just testing it took the power supply off, it stayed on for a few seconds but as soon as i move the computer screen a bit it turns off and wont power up on it. battery has 57% charge.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message:
PPBUS voltage with just battery plugged in?
Try how long it stays on when you pull the AC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message:
11.79v on the ppbus with only the battery connected.

I will test how long it will stay on right now an post back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message:
also it seems like it does not want to power on with the battery installed. but it will after a few tries. its possible maybe the charger adapter is messed up and isnt making the best connection though.  
it also seems like if i move the board it powers off so im wondering maybe a loose component also?   i have left the computer on running only on battery for  10 min + without it powering down and is not showing any signs that it is going to shut down. if i move the computer though it will turn off, it only takes a slight movement or bump and it shuts down.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: Does the shutdown only happen on battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: no it also does it with the power supply.  at first i thought the ps had moved or something causing it to turn off but it clearly is not the charger.

threads.message: Bad RAM slots? Try one at a time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on.
threads.message: nope,  the ram slots seem to be working fine.
